participants.name: Ryan Raub
participants.url: Former Sr. Systems Programmer at Arizona State University

messages.message:
Brian
Hey, what have you been up to since you moved back?
busy with this and that, u?

Brian
yeah same.
Do you still brew?

yeah, actually im looking at beer recipes now
hows Phoenix treating you?

Brian
I would love to learn how to do that.
Pretty good, I have a nice two bed / two bath place in Scottsdale.  I love my job.  I get to do pretty much whatever I want.  I work with really smart and healthy people.
Where are you working?

nice!
i'm working at ASU, and its going rather well also

Brian
Awesome!
We should meet up sometime for a drink or w/e.

yeah, and i can show you the beer brewing stuff
its all at Steve's house

Brian
Yeah, I need to make it over there sometime.

totally
alright I gotta run, i'll ttyl dude

Brian
After working in the field for a few years, do you feel like you could have made that arcade box in a weekend?  I remember how we idolized Murphy.  My company StudySauce is about to finish a semester with a Capstone team at ASU and it reminded me of all the work we did in school.
Are you working with undergraduates at ASU? It is amazing what years of experience equates to.

Brian
Yes.  It's awesome.  I have a couple of projects on the side I am working on.  I am attaching a green house to the side of my house that I want to automate with solenoid valves, raspberry pis, and quad-copters.  It will grow enough spring flowers for the whole neighborhood hopefully.

Brian
I just hooks a pool filter up to a fish tank.  I meant to ask you how your fish tank survived, are you still using it?  I've become quite the blissfully ignorant enthusiast.  7 days and the water is still crystal clear, it might be overkill.

Brian
I have designed a hot tub that I want to build from the mold up, it will be like an above ground jacuzzi that has been sunk 4 feet.  The water will come right up to the rim and sand.  It's amazing what you can save by ordering materials online.
Sounds like a fun project! I kinda quit the aquarium hobby, got too pricy and maintenance was teadious.  I still have a bunch of fish tank pumps and filters that I've been looking to get rid of.

Brian
Yeah, I bet.  The filters you get from retail stores are crap.  The sand at the bottom is the worst.  It holds too much water and therefore algae.  I added little glass marbles offset from the bottom with some mesh wire.  Then I routed a siphon underneath the glass beads to a big sand filter.  It cycles the entire tanks water like 4 times every day. Do you have any glass you want to sell me?

I have a 15 gal I think that I was using for a Refugim (below the main tank) that has some plexiglass sections in it. I also have some aquarium sealant which is good for building water tight joints. You can have any of it if you want it.

Brian
I basically tried to make a huge version of this: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/930441187/noclean-aquariumstm-self-cleaning-aquarium-for-bet

Brian
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10100676540010468&set=a.581359923168.2142189.27705471&type=1&theater
Nice, however nothing is ever that maintenance free.. Still a good system. Here's that tank I was telling you about

Brian
Woah cool, it looks like you literally built your own sand filter.

Brian
I completely lost my mind last week. You always stood our as someone I admire because you seem to have all your crap figured out. I appreciate you.
*stood out
It's been a while since we've hung out, we should probably organize a dinner sometime to catch up. Thanks for the kind words, it's nice to have friends nearby.

Brian
I agree. Thank you for checking in.

Brian
I am sending you this because I have a high regard for your intelligence. I need to speak with you an Matthew Shanker at the same time. I have a test procedure. Pretend you are my DevOps. I will pretend to ask you the most absurd question I can think of to appeal to the most important thing I know about you. I need your trust. If Jesus appeared to you today, is there too much noise on the internet for him to be heard? Do you understand where I am going with this? Communication is key.

Brian
Hmm, too complicated.  How to DevOps think about Sales and Marketing?  Studying one discipline at a time isn't enough.
Yeah sorry I wasn't sure quite what you were asking. I'm not the most knowledgeable about marketing, but I think there is quite a bit of room for automation there.

Brian
I agree!  But what about the noise?
There is so much hate on FB, what can we do to fix it?

Brian
When I get the job at PNNL I will change my status to Supreme Being at Earth.

Brian
I am sorry for that time I tried to charge you money for a video card, computers are useless to me now.
I don't recall a video card exchange.. could you be thinking of someone else

Brian
Nope, it was you.
I had a spare.
Maybe it was Steve.  90% sure it was you though.

Brian
I need to know more about big data.  Recommendations?
